urlText: Double Bay wharf temporary closure
content:
The F7 Double Bay ferry service will not stop at Double Bay Wharf from Tuesday 13 June, while the wharf is upgraded.
 
The closure will continue for approximately six months until November 2023.
 
Alternative transport options include nearby buses, trains at Edgecliff Station and ferries from Darling Point Wharf.

urlText: Extra L1, L2 and L3 light rail services for FIFA Womenâs World Cupâ¢
content:
20 July to 20 August
 
Additional light rail services will run for FIFA Women’s World Cup™ matches at Moore Park and FIFA Fan Festival at Tumbalong Park between 20 July and 20 August 2023.
 
Extra late-night L1 light rail services will run between Central Grand Concourse and Dulwich Hill:
  • Saturday 22 July until 1am
  • Monday 24 July until midnight
  • Wednesday 26 July until 1am
  • Saturday 29 July until 1am
  • Monday 7 August until midnight
  • Tuesday 8 August until midnight
  • Saturday 12 August until midnight
  • Wednesday 16 August until midnight
  • Sunday 20 August until 1am
     
Extra L2 and L3 light rail services will run between Central Chalmers Street and Moore Park before and after each match at Sydney Football Stadium.
 
Allow plenty of extra travel time as all light rail services will be very busy. Consider walking between Central and Moore Park where possible to avoid wait times for transport services.
 
For more information on transport to FIFA Women’s World Cup™ matches see our event page.

urlText: Huntleys Point Wharf power supply repairs
content:
From 7am to 4pm on Tuesday 28 August power will be shut down to Huntleys Point Wharf for repairs.
 
Some facilities will be inoperable during this time including the lift, Opal readers, information screens and lighting.
There will be no impact to services.
 
If the Opal reader is not operational at the start of your journey, you will not be charged for your trip.

If you tap on at the start of your journey and the Opal reader is not operational at your destination, please contact customer service for a fare adjustment.

urlText: Trackwork on the T1 North Shore Line may affect how you travel
content:
Friday 25 to Sunday 27 August
  • From 10.50pm Friday, there is no trackwork on the metro, but trackwork on the T1 North Shore Line may affect how you travel.
  • If you are travelling to the City change at Epping, not Chatswood, for trains to Central.

  • Plan your trip before you travel for up-to-date real time information. You can also subscribe to planned trackwork alerts.

urlText: T1 North Shore Line: Buses replace trains between Hornsby and Central
content:
Monday 21 to Thursday 24 August  
  • Nightly from 9.50pm to 1.30am, buses replace trains between Hornsby and Central.
  • Trains run between Berowra and Hornsby, some to a changed timetable.
  • T1 Western and T9 Northern Line trains start and end at Central, platforms 1-12.

  • Replacement buses may be impacted by driver shortages. We are doing all we can to minimise the impact to your journey and provide a safe service, however cancellations or delays may occur.
  • Plan your trip before you travel for up-to-date real time information. You can also subscribe to planned trackwork alerts.
Bus routes
12T1 Chatswood, then all stations to Central and return
16T1 Hornsby, then all stations to Chatswood, then Wynyard, Town Hall, Central and return

urlText: Buses replace trains between Cronulla and Sutherland

Monday 21 to Thursday 24 August  
  • Nightly from 9.45pm to 2am, buses replace trains between Cronulla and Sutherland.
  • Trains run between Waterfall, Sutherland and Bondi Junction, some to a changed timetable.

  • Replacement buses may be impacted by driver shortages. We are doing all we can to minimise the impact to your journey and provide a safe service, however cancellations or delays may occur.

urlText: Trains run to a changed timetable and stopping pattern
content:
Saturday 26 and Sunday 27 August  
  • Trains run to a changed timetable and stopping pattern. You may need to change trains to continue your journey.
  • Revesby trains run between Revesby and Central only.
  • Most Macarthur trains from the City run via Sydenham. Trains to the City run via the Airport.
  • Early morning and late evening trains run via the Airport but start and end at Central, platform 23.

  • Plan your trip before you travel for up-to-date real time information. You can also subscribe to planned trackwork alerts.

urlText: Circular Quay Wharf Changes to Evening Operations
content:
From 8pm each evening Monday to Sunday, commencing on Monday 26 June, the following changes will apply:
  • F1 Manly services will be relocated from Circular Quay Wharf 3 to Wharf 4, starting with the 8.20pm service onwards
  • F3 Parramatta, F4 Pyrmont Bay and F8 Cockatoo Island services to operate from Wharf 5
  • F5 Neutral Bay, F6 Mosman Bay, F7 Darling Point (Double Bay wharf is currently closed for 6 months) and F9 Watsons Bay services to operate from Wharf 4
subtitle: Circular Quay Wharf Changes to Evening Operations

urlText: Bus diversions for Lane Cove Village Rotary Fair
content:
Sunday 8 October
  • From 6am to 7pm, route 252 and 254 services will divert and miss stops for the Lane Cove Village Rotary Fair.
  • Services will divert from Epping Road via Phoenix Street, Dorritt Street to Longueville Road and via Tambourine Bay Road, Burns Bay Rd, Birdwood Avenue and Longueville Road.
  • Bus Route 254 – Outbound service will be diverted from Epping Road via Phoenix
Affected stops
  • Longueville Rd opp Lane Cove Library (206635)
  • Longueville Rd opp Lane Cove Public School (206636)
  • St Michaels Parish, Longueville Rd (206637)
  • River Rd West at Tambourine Bay Rd (206670)
  • River Rd West opp William Edward St (206674)

Check signs at stops for alternative stop locations and allow extra travel time.

urlText: T1 Western Line: Buses replace trains between Emu Plains and Blacktown
content:
Saturday 2 and Sunday 3 September   
  • Buses replace trains between Emu Plains and Blacktown.
  • Trains run to a changed timetable between Blacktown and Central, platforms 1-12 only.
  • Richmond trains run between Richmond and Olympic Park. Change at Parramatta to continue your journey towards the City.
  • Sunday from 6.30am to 10.30am, Richmond trains run between Richmond and Leppington.

  • Doonside Station: The footbridge will be closed. A shuttle bus service will run between the Hill End Road side of the station to Doonside Road. Please allow extra time.   

  • Replacement buses may be impacted by driver shortages. We are doing all we can to minimise the impact to your journey and provide a safe service, however cancellations or delays may occur.
  • Plan your trip before you travel for up-to-date real time information. You can also subscribe to planned trackwork alerts.

urlText: Buses replace trains between Lithgow and Mount Victoria
content:
Monday 28 August to Friday 1 September
  • From 2am Monday to 10pm Friday, buses replace trains between Lithgow and Mount Victoria, then continue to Blackheath.
  • Trains run between Mount Victoria and Central, some to a changed timetable.
  • Bathurst trains run between Bathurst and Mount Victoria or Central, to a changed timetable. Trains will not stop at Lithgow but make an extra stop at Blackheath.
  • There is no lift at Mount Victoria. Change at Blackheath for easy access.

  • Friday from 10pm, buses replace trains from Lithgow to Blacktown.
  • The last train to Central leaves Mount Victoria at 21:01, arriving Central at 23:21.
  • From 11pm, buses replace trains from Blacktown to Lithgow.
  • The last train to the Blue Mountains leaves Central at 22:18, arriving Mount Victoria 00:37.
  • T1 Western Line trains run between the City and St Marys, to a changed timetable. Change at Blacktown for buses to Blue Mountains Line stations.

  • If you are travelling to Lithgow to connect with NSW TrainLink Regional Coaches, please call 132 232 to confirm departure times.

  • Replacement buses may be impacted by driver shortages. We are doing all we can to minimise the impact to your journey and provide a safe service, however cancellations or delays may occur.
  • Plan your trip before you travel for up-to-date real time information. You can also subscribe to planned trackwork alerts.
Bus routes
10BM Bathurst, then Tarana, Rydal and Lithgow and return
38BM Lithgow, then all stations to Blackheath and return
 
Friday night
1ABM Springwood, then all stations to Penrith and return
4BM Katoomba, then stations all to Blaxland, then express to Blacktown and return
53BM Lithgow, then all stations to Katoomba, Springwood, Blaxland, Blacktown and return
subtitle: Buses replace trains between Lithgow and Mount Victoria

urlText: Station Update - Revesby
content: From Monday 14 August 2023, sections of the Revesby Station car park off Marco Avenue will be closed for up to 10 weeks. The existing accessible parking spaces will be relocated within the existing car park.This is to enable power supply upgrade work as part of the AC Feeder project. Alternative parking for rail passengers is available at the multi-storey Revesby Commuter Car Park located adjacent to Haydock Lane.

urlText: Robert St, Rozelle, temporary bus stop closures
content:
On the following nights:
  • 9pm to 5am Monday 28 August 2023
  • 9pm to 5am Wednesday 30 August 2023
  • 9pm to 5am Thursday 31 August 2023
  • 9pm to 5am Monday 4 September 2023
  • 9pm to 5am Wednesday 6 September 2023
  • 9pm to 5am Thursday 7 September 2023
Due to Rozelle Interchange work, the following bus stop will be temporarily closed:
  • Bus stop Robert St at Crescent St (203933) will close. The alternative stop will be bus stop Victoria Rd Opp Robert St (203921) for the following services:
    • 441 – Birchgrove
    • 442 – Balmain
  • Bus stop Mullens St after Mansfield St (203934) will close. The alternative stop will be Victoria Rd at Evans St (203922) for the following services:
    • 441 – Birchgrove 
    • 442 – Balmain
There will be alternative stops for some services as a result of the following temporary bus stop closures: 
  • Bus stop Mullens St at Reynolds St (204146) will be temporarily closed.
  • Bus stop Mullens St at Beattie St (204147) will be temporarily closed.
  • Bus stop Montague St before Darling St (204148) will be temporarily closed.
    • The alternative stop for the 441 to Birchgrove service will be Rowntree St after Darling St (204114).
    • The alternative stop for the 442 to Balmain service is Darling St at Phillip St (204124).

urlText: Some bus services diverted at Harris Rd at Garfield St
content:
Some bus services on route 502 are diverted due to special event.
From 3am to 11pm on Sunday 20 August, buses will be diverting around a section of Great North Rd and missing stops due to road closures for the Ferragosto Festival event.
 
Services towards the city will continue on Lyons Rd West to return to route on Lyons Rd. Services travelling towards Cabarita Wharf will do the same in reverse.
 
Check signs at stops for alternative stop locations and allow extra travel time.
 
Missed and alternative stops

  • Ramsay Rd at Fairlight St (2046142)

  • Garfield St at West St (2046149)
    Alternative stop Harris Rd opp Garfield St (204684)
  • Five Dock-Drummoyne Uniting Church, Garfield St (2046150)
    Alternative stop Harris Rd at Garfield St (204692)
  • Garfield St before Harris Rd (2046151)
    Alternative stop Harris Rd at Garfield St (204692)
Plan ahead and allow extra travel time.

urlText: Mona Vale bus diversions for fun run
content:
Sunday 27 August
  • From 7am to 11am, route 155 services to and from Mona Vale will divert via Melbourne Ave while roads are closed for the Beach2Beach fun run.
  • Services will miss stops on Coronation St at Mona Vale Hospital and on Narrabeen Park Pde. Use the alternate temporary stop on Melbourne Ave between Coronation St and Cook Tce instead.
  • Check signs at bus stops and allow extra travel time.
  • For more information visit the Beach2Beach fun run event page.

urlText: Mascot bus diversions
content:
From 10pm Friday 25 to 5am Monday 28 August, due to Botany Rail Duplication work, there will be temporary service changes for the following routes:
  • The 350 Sydney Airport Domestic service will not stop at the following bus stops:
    • Bus stop on Mascot Shops, Botany Rd (202017)
    • Bus stop on Mascot Public School, Botany Rd Mascot (202018)
    • Bus stop on Mascot Memorial Park, Botany Rd, Mascot (202019)
    • Bus stop on Lionel Bowen Park, Coward St, Mascot (202031)
    • Bus stop on Mascot Station, Coward St, Stand B, Mascot (2020114)
    • Bus stop on Bourke Rd opp Qantas Corporate Office, Mascot (202061)
    • Bus stop on O'Riordan St after King St, Mascot (202073)
  • The 420S shuttle bus will be available instead and will provide a loop service to Sydney Airport Domestic via Mascot during this time.
     
  • The 350 Sydney Airport Domestic and the 420 Burwood services will not stop at bus stop Mascot Station, Coward St, Mascot (2020114). The 420S shuttle bus will be available instead to Sydney Airport Domestic. The 420 Burwood service will depart from Sydney Airport Domestic (202067).

urlText: Five Dock bus diversions for Ferragosto Festival
content:
From 3am to 11pm on Sunday 20 August, buses will be diverting around a section of Great North Rd and missing stops due to road closures for the Ferragosto Festival event.
 
Services in both directions will start and end their trips at Domremy College, First Ave.  
 
Services travelling away from Five Dock will divert from Domremy College on First Ave via Park Rd and Fairlight St to return to route on Great North Rd.
 
Services travelling towards Five Dock will divert away from Great North Rd via Fairlight St, Ingham Ave, First Ave and then terminate at Domremy College.
 
Check signs at stops for alternative stop locations and allow extra travel time.
 
Missed and alternative stops
  • Club Five Dock RSL, Great North Rd (2046143)
    Alternative stop Fairlight St at Ramsay Rd (2046153)

urlText: L2 Randwick Line and L3 Kingsford Line weeknight full closures
content:
From Monday 21 to Wednesday 23 August, nightly from 9pm to 1am, L2 Randwick Line and L3 Kingsford Line light rail services will not run due to planned trackwork and maintenance works.
 
During this time, use alternative transport including:
  • Replacement bus services between Central Chalmers Street and Randwick or Juniors Kingsford,
  • Trains, regular bus services or walk, between Circular Quay and Central Chalmers Street.
See the News story for more information on alternative transport options.
 
Allow extra travel time and use the Trip Planner or check travel alerts to see if you travel is affected.

urlText: Accessible entrance - Parramatta Wharf
content:
Construction at Parramatta Wharf will continue until mid-September. Passengers, particularly those less mobile or those travelling with prams, should note that due to construction of Charles Street Square there are alternative routes in place from the ferry to the City centre. While pedestrian routes are stair-free they are not fully accessible. Passengers may wish to consider other transport options for visiting Parramatta.

Read more about Charles St Square Upgrade
subtitle: Accessible entrance - Parramatta Wharf

urlText: Special Events
content:
NRL Knights Double Header - McDonald Jones Stadium, Broadmeadow
NLRW: Knights v Broncos - 12:00 to 13:50
NRL: Knights v Rabbitohs - 14:00 to 16:00
- The closest station to the stadium is Broadmeadow on the Central Coast & Newcastle Line. It is approximately a 15 minute walk away.

FIFA World Cup Final Spain v England - Stadium Australia, Sydney Olympic Park
20:00 to 22:00
- Valid pre-purchased tickets include travel on Sydney Trains, Sydney Bus, Sydney Metro and Light Rail services.
- Trains will run regularly from Central stopping at Redfern, Strathfield then Olympic Park.
- Trains run regularly to Lidcombe where you can head to Platform Zero for a direct train to Olympic Park.
- After the match, trains will run to Central and Western Line stations until late to get you home.

For details, please visit https://transportnsw.info/events/2023/08

urlText: MacArthur St, Parramatta temporary bus stop closures
content:
From 8pm Friday 18 August to 5am Friday 24 November, Gasworks Bridge work will result in the following bus stop closures:
  • Bus stops MacArthur Girls High School, MacArthur St (2150116) and MacArthur St after Thomas St (215043) will close. The alternative stop will be Victoria Rd at Brabyn St (215067) for the 545 towards Macquarie Park.
  • Bus stops George St after Smith St (215069) and George St before MacArthur St (215070) will close.  The alternative stop will be Smith St before Phillip St (215066) for the 545 towards Macquarie Park.

urlText: Buses replace trains between Richmond and Blacktown
content:
Monday 28 to Thursday 31 August  
  • Nightly from 7.30pm to 1.30am, buses replace trains between Richmond and Blacktown.
  • Buses towards Blacktown may leave up to 20 minutes earlier than the normal train timetable.

  • Tuesday and Wednesday, nightly from 11.50pm to 1.30am, some trains run to a changed timetable between Blacktown or Leppington and Olympic Park only. Some trains start and end at Granville.
  • You may need to change trains at Granville to continue your journey.

  • Replacement buses may be impacted by driver shortages. We are doing all we can to minimise the impact to your journey and provide a safe service, however cancellations or delays may occur.
  • Plan your trip before you travel for up-to-date real time information. You can also subscribe to planned trackwork alerts.
Bus routes
50T1 Blacktown, then all stations to Richmond and return
52T1 Blacktown, then all stations to Riverstone and return

urlText: Sydney Olympic Park Major Event Buses for FIFA Womenâs World Cupâ¢ matches
content:
Sydney Olympic Park Major Event Buses will run on all nine routes for FIFA Women’s World Cup™ matches at Sydney Olympic Park on Thu 20 July, Mon 7, Sat 12, Wed 16 and Sun 20 August.
 
Buses will start running to Olympic Park from mid-afternoon. Buses will start leaving Olympic Park at the conclusion of the game, inclusive of extra time and/or penalties. Buses will not start leaving the precinct prior to the conclusion of the game.
 
For information on service times for each game see the event pages or use the Trip Planner.
subtitle: Sydney Olympic Park Major Event Buses for FIFA Womenâs World Cupâ¢ matches

urlText: Sydney Olympic Park diversions for FIFA Womenâs World Cupâ¢
content:
Route 525 services to and from Sydney Olympic Park will be diverting while roads are closed for FIFA Women’s World Cup™ matches at Stadium Australia.
 
Services will miss stops on Dawn Fraser Ave and some stops on Park St in both directions. Use alternative stops on Edwin Flack Ave or on Park St at Olympic Park Station instead.
 
Check signs at bus stops and allow extra travel time. For more transport information see our FIFA Women’s World Cup 2023™ page.
 
Missed & Alternative Stops
  • Dawn Fraser Ave near Edwin Flack Ave (212788) – alternative stop at Edwin Flack Ave after Sarah Durack Ave (212732)
  • Dawn Fraser Ave after Edwin Flack Ave (212787) – alternative stop at Sydney Olympic Park Athletic Centre Edwin Flack Ave (212733)                                                                                         
  • Dawn Fraser Ave opp Olympic Park Station Sydney Olympic Park (212791) – alternative stop at Olympic Park Station Park St (212712)
  • Olympic Park Station, Dawn Fraser Ave (212792) – alternative stop at Olympic Park Station Park St (212712)
  • Park St opp Olympic Park Station (212790) – alternative stop at Olympic Park Station Park St (212712)
